We need to make sure that we all can discuss our mental health challenges and get whatever help we may need—that's why I am telling my own story and encouraging others to tell theirs.  https://www.mobilize.us/sethmoulton/  pic.twitter.com/FrZSiGF9dl

—Establish 511 as a National Mental Health Crisis Hotline
—Build awareness for 511 & mental health challenges through public ad campaigns, including digital targeting for those who search for help online, & by talking more openly about our challenges to de-stigmatize these issues

—Establish the importance of mental health at a young age by funding yearly mental health screenings for every high schooler in America
—Introduce mental health training into the physical education curriculum of high schools in America

—Make mental health check-ups as routine as physicals for active-duty military & veterans
—Require mandatory counseling for everyone returning from a combat deployment
—Adopt a holistic approach to treatment, including alternative therapies like mindfulness, exercise, & cannabis
Mental health care should be a regular part of American life, and veterans can lead the way in ending the stigma around these issues for good. Here’s what my plan would do:

That’s why I’m outlining the boldest, most detailed mental health plan by a presidential candidate this cycle, starting with our veterans. Veterans are at higher risk of mental health challenges like PTS, and their care should set the standard.  https://sethmoulton.com/mental-health/

Mental health should become a routine part of healthcare in America: for our troops, our veterans—for everybody. Veterans across the country are opening up about our post-traumatic stress & mental health challenges because it is vital we end the stigma around these issues.

Serving comes in many forms, not just joining the military. That's why my plan focuses on civilian service programs like AmeriCorps & a new Federal Green Corps to tackle domestic issues like ensuring every American has a safe community, clean water, and dependable infrastructure. https://twitter.com/lukesumms/status/1130115232251219968 …

There is no limit to what millions of young Americans working together can achieve. That's why the goal of this plan is to unite Americans around solving these problems, and to reward them for doing so.

We’re going to increase our investment in AmeriCorps​, ​FEMA Corps, and AmeriCorps VISTA​, so any American who wants to can help rebuild infrastructure, tackle lead abatement, plan response and relief efforts during a disaster, and spear-head anti-poverty projects.

Much like the Civilian Conservation Corps built & maintained our National Parks in the 1930s, the Federal Green Corps will take on projects to make communities more resilient from rising oceans, ensure clean air & water, & retrofit public buildings to make them energy-efficient.

Expand the Corporation for National and Community Service:

Rename it the National and Community Service Administration and expand its mission and scope.

Make national service a cabinet position:

Elevate the Administrator of the newly-restructured National and Community Service Administration to a cabinet-level position, giving this new secretary a seat at the table for tackling the country’s biggest challenges.

Create the Federal Green Corps:

Build a new service organization with the mission of combating climate change and protecting our environment.

Ask all young Americans to serve:

Launch a large-scale national recruiting effort to reach all 33.4 million Americans aged 17 to 24 and ask them to serve their country.

That’s why my national civilian service plan is modeled on the GI Bill and designed to build on its success fostering a culture of service to this country we love. Because if you invest in America, we should invest in you.

Here's what this plan will do:

I’m calling for a National Service Education Guarantee because I want every American to have an opportunity to serve—a chance to confront the challenges our country faces today, be a part of something bigger than themselves, and a promise they will be rewarded for their efforts.

Today I'm making the biggest call to national service since World War II. I'm asking all 33 million young Americans to consider serving. And if you invest in your country, we'll invest in you.  https://sethmoulton.com/national-service/ … pic.twitter.com/JWoka5PNRX
